intro: Ansonia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf ansonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Ansonia latifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to tolerate partial shade.
